title: Analyze the bond types in acetylene
text: Acetylene (C₂H₂) has both sigma and pi bonds. Can you recall which atoms form each type of bond?

title: Consider the molecular structure
text: Think about the arrangement of carbon and hydrogen atoms in acetylene. What types of bonds usually form between carbon and hydrogen?

title: Think about the types of bonds
text: In a typical carbon-carbon triple bond found in acetylene, what combination of bonds is present? Hint: Remember how pi and sigma bonds are involved.

title: Think about Bond Types
text: What types of bonds are formed in acetylene? Remember to consider types like sigma and pi bonds.

title: Understanding Sigma and Pi Bonds
text: Consider the distinct characteristics of sigma and pi bonds. Which is the first bond to form when two atoms share electrons?

title: Visual Representation of Bonds
text: Try to imagine or draw a structure of acetylene. How do the bonds appear? Which are single, double, or triple?
